programme.title: The Goldbergs

programme.title: The Goldbergs

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: Conan the Barbarian
programme.desc: (2011) Fantasy action-adventure. Jason Momoa stars as Conan, who sets out to kill the evil warlord who massacred his village when he was young. With Stephen Lang and Rose McGowan.

programme.title: Boss Level
programme.desc: (2020) Groundhog day shoot 'em up with Frank Grillo, Naomi Watts and Mel Gibson. Ray gets killed every day. Can he escape by unravelling the mystery of why a bunch of people want him dead?

programme.title: Rules Don't Apply
programme.desc: (2016) Warren Beatty's 1950s-set romance starring Lily Collins. Reclusive billionaire Howard Hughes (Beatty) brings a young woman to Hollywood. Will she find the fame she's dreaming of?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The War Lover
programme.desc: (1962) War film with Steve McQueen and Robert Wagner. A US pilot stationed in Britain during WWII alienates his comrades with his self-serving antics.

programme.title: Von Ryan's Express
programme.desc: (1965) Second World War adventure. Frank Sinatra stars as the leader of Allied prisoners of war attempting to slip the clutches of their Italian captors. Co-starring Trevor Howard.

programme.title: Yesterday's Enemy
programme.desc: (1959) Wartime drama with Stanley Baker. The captain of a British army patrol deciphers secret enemy battle plans, but does so at a great moral cost.

programme.title: The Bravados
programme.desc: (1958) Brooding western starring Joan Collins and Gregory Peck. A man hunts down the four escaped prisoners who he believes are responsible for the murder of his wife.

programme.title: The Old Man and the Gun
programme.desc: (2018) Crime biopic. Robert Redford stars as charming 74-year-old robber Forrest Tucker. He's still robbing banks when he falls for farmer Jewel (Sissy Spacek). But the cops still want him.

programme.title: Jack Reacher: Never Go Back
programme.desc: (2016) Action-thriller sequel with Tom Cruise, Cobie Smulders and Danika Yarosh. Vigilante Jack Reacher gets simultaneously caught up in a deadly conspiracy and a paternity case.

programme.title: Raging Grace
programme.desc: (2023) Gothic horror with Max Eigenmann. A Filipina cleaner takes a job in a big, creepy house so she and her daughter can stay in the UK. But there's an old man in a coma in the attic...

programme.title: Hearts of Darkness: A...
programme.desc: ...Filmmaker's Apocalypse: (1991) Documentary charting the problems that plagued the Apocalypse Now shoot, threatening this cinematic landmark, Coppola's career and even one actor's life.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Nevadan
programme.desc: (1950) Western with Randolph Scott and Dorothy Malone. A cunning US Marshal pretends to be a doofus to get a bank robber to take him to the hidden loot.

programme.title: Hangman's Knot
programme.desc: (1952) Civil War-era Western. A unit of Confederate soldiers attack a Union troop to steal gold. Learning that the war is over, they must finish the mission in disguise.

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: (1957) Drama with Rita Hayworth, Robert Mitchum and Jack Lemmon. Two friends agree to smuggle a mysterious European woman across the border, but she soon has them at each other's throats.

programme.title: Sink the Bismarck!
programme.desc: (1960) Second World War drama. Kenneth More stars as the British captain charged with finding and destroying the Bismarck, Germany's largest battleship. Directed by Lewis Gilbert.

programme.title: Deep Impact
programme.desc: (1998) Elijah Wood and Morgan Freeman star in the sci-fi disaster movie about impending meteorite-related disaster, attempts to destroy it, and possibly some cataclysmic havoc.

programme.title: Apocalypse Now
programme.desc: (1979) Final cut of Coppola's award-laden take on the Vietnam War, with Martin Sheen and Marlon Brando. An assassin travels upriver to terminate a renegade colonel with extreme prejudice.

programme.title: London Has Fallen
programme.desc: (2016) All-out action as Gerard Butler returns as US Secret Service agent Mike Banning in the second instalment of the Has Fallen franchise. Mike and POTUS get in a pickle in London.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Fantastic Voyage
programme.desc: (1966) Classic sci-fi adventure. Raquel Welch and Donald Pleasence are among the crew of a miniaturised submarine that's injected into an injured diplomat's body in a bid to save his life.

programme.title: Patrick
programme.desc: (2018) Feel-good British family comedy. Sarah's (Beattie Edmondson) chaotic life gets even more complicated when she inherits a naughty pug from her nan.

programme.title: The Next Karate Kid
programme.desc: (1994) Kicking family action sequel. Hilary Swank takes on the karate kid soubriquet, as the venerable Mr Miyagi helps her to battle her teenage demons.

programme.title: Dante's Peak
programme.desc: (1997) Action thriller starring Pierce Brosnan and Linda Hamilton. The inhabitants of a volcano-side resort unwisely ignore a scientist's warning about its imminent eruption.

programme.title: 10 Things I Hate About You
programme.desc: (1999) Teen comedy with Julia Stiles and Heath Ledger. A student is furious to discover her prom date was bribed by her sister to invite her. But confusion ensues when he falls for her.

programme.title: The Northman
programme.desc: (2022) Epic Viking saga starring Alexander Skarsgård as a warrior prince who goes on the rampage to Iceland to avenge his murdered father. With Ethan Hawke, Nicole Kidman and Björk.

programme.desc: (2011) Fantasy action-adventure. Jason Momoa stars as Conan, who sets out to kill the evil warlord who massacred his village when he was young. With Stephen Lang and Rose McGowan.

programme.desc: Andrew and Bev present every weekday morning. When the news happens, it happens here. But what does it mean for you? GB News brings you the biggest stories and the answers you need from across the UK.

programme.title: Battle Of The Alphas

programme.title: Age Of The Big Cats

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz in which players are presented with clues in the form of answers and must phrase their responses in the form of a question

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Undercover Police Scandal: Love and Lies Exposed
programme.desc: The women unite to take legal action and share their eerily similar experiences and copycat letters from their former partners. programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Weight Loss Jab: Getting to the Right People? Tonight
programme.desc: Unless things change, more than half of the population will be classed as overweight or obese by 2050. With soaring demand for weight loss injections, Ranvir Singh investigates who is getting them and whether tighter restrictions regarding online prescribing will work

programme.title: The Undercover Police Scandal: Love and Lies Exposed
programme.desc: A mutual friend introduces Helen and Alison, and they work out that their former partners must have belonged to a Metropolitan Police squad that infiltrated left-wing groups. No-one is interested in their story and both women are forced to move on with their lives. Seven years later, an online post finally unmasks former officer Mark Kennedy, whose undercover name was Mark Stone

programme.title: Emergency Nurses: A&E Stories

programme.title: ITV Evening News

programme.title: World Cup Qualifier
programme.desc: England v Albania (Kick-off 7.45pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of both teams' opening Group K match, held at Wembley Stadium. This is Thomas Tuchel's first match as head coach of England and he will be expecting to get off to a winning start in a group that also contains Serbia, Latvia and Andorra. The teams were also in the same qualifying group for the 2022 World Cup, when England overcame the Albanians 2-0 in Tirana and 5-0 here. With analysis from Roy Keane and Ian Wright, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell follow the stories of foundlings as they search for answers about why they were left as babies and try to find their birth families. A police detective left on church steps as a baby, who has been unable to solve the mystery of his own identity, finally discovers the truth. Elsewhere, a woman left in a hospital in the 1960s receives surprising news about her birth family

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: A vagrant is found dead in the doorway of Leonard's cafe. Geordie can't shake the feeling that this murder could be connected to two previous unsolved cases - is there a killer out there targeting the homeless?

programme.title: Unwind with STV
programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: M&S: Dress the Nation
programme.desc: Hosts Vernon Kay and AJ Odudu are joined by guest judge Alex Scott as the designers compete to win a dream job at high street giant Marks and Spencer in Sportswear Week.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Greg from Merthyr Tydfil, Viv from London, Sadie from Port Glasgow and Charles from Essex pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Actor Samantha Bond, musical theatre legend Sir Tim Rice and Coronation Street star Claire Sweeney join Alan in meeting some young alpacas. Chris Hull shares tips for revitalising the lawn for spring and Jaega Wise picks her top pints from across the UK

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: The chef enjoys recipes from Asma Khan, Ashley Palmer-Watts and Jonny Lake and cooks a dish of his own for former Wham! star Pepsi DeMacque-Crockett

programme.title: Prue Leith's Cotswold Kitchen
programme.desc: The cookery writer and Great British Bake Off judge is joined in the kitchen of her Cotswold home by actress, model and radio host Kelly Brook, who tackles the Italian dish of chicken saltimbocca as the pair discuss love, life and lingerie. Prue prepares a vegetarian curry and gives her tips for some kitchen staples

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: STV Racing: Live from Kelso
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of the days racing from Kelso, Newbury and Bangor. With analysis from Tom Scudamore and Mick Fitzgerald, commentary by Mark Johnson, and reports from Oli Bell and Natalie Green and

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Mark Chapman, Gillian Joseph, Ryan Sidebottom and Fred MacAulay pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: 99 to Beat
programme.desc: Adam and Ryan Thomas host as 100 ordinary people compete in a series of simple games to win a cash prize, all they have to do is not finish in last place. In the first episode, the contestants are tasked with sitting down on an exercise ball whilst blindfolded, successfully stacking a slinky on their forehead without using their hands and balancing a drinks can at a 45-degree angle

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: More acts audition for a place in the semi-finals, with judges Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon, Bruno Tonioli and KSI deciding which ones will go through, under the watchful eye of Ant and Dec

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by national treasure Stephen Fry, star of The White Lotus and Sex Education Aimee Lou Wood, BAFTA Rising Star nominee Sope Dirisu and comedian Joanne McNally. Plus, a musical performance from Yungblud

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Unstoppable
programme.desc: Action thriller starring Denzel Washington and Chris Pine. A runaway train loaded with toxic chemicals will derail in a populated area unless two rail company workers can put their differences aside and to try to prevent catastrophe.

The teams were also in the same qualifying group for the 2022 World Cup, when England overcame the Albanians 2-0 in Tirana and 5-0 here. With analysis from Roy Keane and Ian Wright, and commentary by Sam Matterface and Lee Dixon

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: Long Lost Family: Born Without Trace
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell follow the stories of foundlings as they search for answers about why they were left as babies and try to find their birth families. A police detective left on church steps as a baby, who has been unable to solve the mystery of his own identity, finally discovers the truth. Elsewhere, a woman left in a hospital in the 1960s receives surprising news about her birth family

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: A vagrant is found dead in the doorway of Leonard's cafe. Geordie can't shake the feeling that this murder could be connected to two previous unsolved cases - is there a killer out there targeting the homeless?

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals

programme.title: ITV News and Weather

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Mark Chapman, Gillian Joseph, Ryan Sidebottom and Fred MacAulay pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: 99 to Beat
programme.desc: Adam and Ryan Thomas host as 100 ordinary people compete in a series of simple games to win a cash prize, all they have to do is not finish in last place. In the first episode, the contestants are tasked with sitting down on an exercise ball whilst blindfolded, successfully stacking a slinky on their forehead without using their hands and balancing a drinks can at a 45-degree angle

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to £100,000?
